2022-05-22T15:07:05Z: And that's all from us - we'll see you next weekend for the Monaco Grand Prix! Take it easy.
2022-05-22T15:06:36Z: Here's the race report, if you fancy a recap of events from Barcelona: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/spanish-f1-gp-race-report-verstappen-wins-leclerc-retires/10309015/
2022-05-22T14:42:46Z: Ocon is seventh, ahead of a unwell Norris who claims eighth, as Alonso and Tsunoda complete the top 10.
2022-05-22T14:42:10Z: Carlos Sainz bags a late fourth, as Hamilton dropped to fifth earlier after Mercedes was worried about losing both cars. Bottas collects sixth.
2022-05-22T14:41:21Z: Sergio Perez follows his Red Bull team-mate home to claim second, as Russell cruises to the finish to collect third place and a podium.
2022-05-22T14:40:44Z: Max Verstappen wins the 2022 Spanish Grand Prix!
2022-05-22T14:40:07Z: Final lap, and Verstappen's working his way through the last corners.
2022-05-22T14:39:35Z: Ricciardo gets by Schumacher for 12th place, the Haas driver is really limping home now.
2022-05-22T14:37:30Z: Ah, Latifi proves us wrong, as he gets by Magnussen to take 16th place with a classic DRS-aided Turn 1 divebomb.
2022-05-22T14:35:11Z: We've not seen much of it but Albon's had a race to forget. He's pitted four times and is 44s off team-mate Latifi, with both Williams drivers the last running cars.
2022-05-22T14:34:24Z: Five laps remaining, and Verstappen is 19.5s up the road from Perez.
2022-05-22T14:33:34Z: Vettel gets by Schumacher for 11th place, with the Haas really struggling on old mediums, as he's over three seconds a lap off the pace.
2022-05-22T14:32:25Z: Lap 60, and Hamilton evades Sainz's defence and steams around the outside at Turn 1 - not a bad recovery given his lap 1 travails.
2022-05-22T14:31:38Z: For fans of the Schumacher-Vettel bromance, take a deep breath. Once again the pair are coming close to each other with the elder German catching the Haas for 11th place. After Miami please play nice, guys.
2022-05-22T14:30:52Z: Bottas thus complains that the strategy wasn't right, but he's about 30s up the road from Ocon at the moment with eight laps left.
2022-05-22T14:29:39Z: Sainz dips past Bottas at Turn 1 on lap 58, claiming fourth, and Hamilton then dispatches his former team-mate by cruising around the outside of Turn 3.
2022-05-22T14:28:28Z: Sainz has caught up to Bottas now, as the aged mediums on the Alfa Romeo continue to dwindle in usefulness. Hamilton's on the back of Sainz now too.
2022-05-22T14:27:24Z: Perez posts a 1m24.108s to ensure the gap to Verstappen isn't as heavy as it was recently - and to pick up the provisional fastest lap point.
2022-05-22T14:27:23Z: And that's Schumacher's potential for his first F1 points gone for another race, as he loses 10th place to Tsunoda who had DRS and fresher tyres.
2022-05-22T14:26:30Z: Alonso makes quick work of getting back by Schumacher, who is struggling on his old medium tyres, for ninth place. Tsunoda is bearing down on the pair now.
2022-05-22T14:25:47Z: Sainz is hacking out large swathes of time from Bottas in fourth, going 1.5s faster on the previous lap. 10 laps remaining.
2022-05-22T14:24:43Z: Alonso has a slow stop of 5.9s and comes out behind Schumacher but still ahead of Tsunoda. A sticky front-right wheel leaves the Alpine pitcrew fuming.
2022-05-22T14:23:13Z: Ocon pits to cover off Norris, while Tsunoda pits on the same lap which sees him drop behind Schumacher in the fight for 10th place.
2022-05-22T14:22:21Z: Didn't take much for Russell to clear Bottas, and indeed duly does so to claim back third place. Bottas is starting to see the end of his medium tyres.
2022-05-22T14:21:36Z: Norris the next to pit and drops back to 10th place with fresh softs.
2022-05-22T14:21:09Z: It's now a 1m24.253s for Hamilton, who's looking to usurp Sainz for fifth. Hefty pace.
2022-05-22T14:20:28Z: Russell comes in for pitstop number three, taking soft tyres. Bottas moves up to third, but there'll be a significant tyre off-set in these closing 14 laps.
2022-05-22T14:19:41Z: Hamilton also dropped the fastest lap so far with a 1m25.106s on that lap, so he's got great pace.
2022-05-22T14:18:55Z: Just like that, Hamilton gets ahead of Ocon with DRS into Turn 1 to take sixth place.
2022-05-22T14:18:26Z: Hamilton should be able to reel in Ocon but with Sainz next up the road, sixth place could be as good as it gets for Hamilton this afternoon. It is where he started, after all.
2022-05-22T14:16:40Z: Hamilton completes his final scheduled stop of the day, onto the soft tyres. He rejoins in P7, behind Ocon.
2022-05-22T14:16:03Z: In truth, Tsunoda is pulling away from the rest of the midfield behind him so his 10th place looks safe for now. Those ahead are chopping and changing places, mind.
2022-05-22T14:14:00Z: Verstappen's already brought the gap to Perez down to 1.8s, so it's been a circuitous road to what's shaping up to be a familiar result. Sainz gets back into the top six with a move on Ocon.
2022-05-22T14:12:37Z: Sainz has completed his third and final stop, returning to the circuit in seventh place on soft rubber.
2022-05-22T14:11:28Z: Fresh mediums for Verstappen, and he's already looking to close down the five-second gap to Perez.
2022-05-22T14:11:16Z: Vettel, on those fresh mediums, gets by Gasly with ease at Turn 1 to take 13th place. He's got nearly 20 seconds to find to reach the points, so it might be too big an ask with 20 laps to go.
2022-05-22T14:10:00Z: And Verstappen does indeed do his third stop, and gets out ahead of Russell to emerge second. 21 laps remain.
2022-05-22T14:09:01Z: Hamilton now gets shown the black and white flag for exceeding track limits too many times. He keeps being pinged for the offence at Turn 12, which is where Norris fell foul and lost his best Q2 time yesterday.
2022-05-22T14:08:28Z: Perez is keeping the gap to Verstappen at about 16.5s, as Verstappen's tyres look a little ragged at this point. Checo wants to win today, but has to brace himself for a late charge...
2022-05-22T14:07:59Z: At the end of lap 42 Vettel finally pits again, taking on fresh mediums, and comes out in 14th place.
2022-05-22T14:06:58Z: Pastor Maldonado comes onto the screen - to paraphrase Football Cliches, 'there's a man who knows a thing or two about winning in Spain'.
2022-05-22T14:06:55Z: Albon has been shown the black and white flag for track limits.
2022-05-22T14:04:23Z: A small moment of joy for Magnussen on a tough afternoon as he passes Albon for 17th place. But it probably won't be celebrated too hard on the Haas pitwall.
2022-05-22T14:02:51Z: It's lap 40. Verstappen is 17s up the road from Perez, although there's two different strategies for them. Russell's a further 4.5s back, and Bottas is now watching Sainz get closer in his mirrors.
2022-05-22T14:01:59Z: Norris overtakes Vettel with DRS at Turn 1, with the German yet to make a second pitstop, to see the McLaren driver take eighth place and continue his chase of Ocon.
2022-05-22T13:59:52Z: Perez bins off the one-stop strategy and grabs the medium compound of tyre to potentially cover off a charge from Russell. We're expecting Verstappen to three-stop today.
2022-05-22T13:57:57Z: Russell denies Verstappen the satisfaction of making the pass on him by diving into the pits for his second stop. There's some mediums for Russell, so we anticipate a two-stop there.
2022-05-22T13:56:46Z: Ocon comes in for his second stop - coming out on softs in seventh behind Lewis Hamilton, who's been on a charge today.
2022-05-22T13:55:51Z: Meanwhile the various pitstops and troubles ahead have lifted Hamilton to seventh for the time being. Alonso, who started last remember, is into the points in 10th place overtaking Tsunoda at Turn 1.
2022-05-22T13:55:45Z: Bottas conducts stop number 2, onto the medium tyres. He drops behind Ocon but ahead of Sainz - so that's P5. Should any fate befall the top three, Bottas could be on for a podium today.
2022-05-22T13:54:07Z: Magnussen is on the lesser-spotted hard tyres. Well, running a distant last place he doesn't have much to lose so is going to the end on those.
2022-05-22T13:53:41Z: Norris calls in for his second stop from sixth place, which will bring Sainz back up to the top six. Soft boots for the McLaren.
2022-05-22T13:52:55Z: Verstappen's continuing to chase after Russell, as he's the quickest driver on track right now. Second quickest? Lewis Hamilton, who's got up to eighth.
2022-05-22T13:51:31Z: The second pitstop cycle is rotating as Alonso and Ricciardo head in for fresh tyres at the end of lap 32.
2022-05-22T13:50:57Z: Sainz pits for his second stop, just before half distance and he claims another set of mediums.
2022-05-22T13:50:18Z: Verstappen also makes light work of Bottas, around the outside of Turn 12 and gets up to third!
2022-05-22T13:49:57Z: Verstappen's out on softs after his second stop - setting a 1m25.732s! But will those tyres last more than half of the race in this heat?
2022-05-22T13:49:41Z: Zhou has become the second Spanish GP retirement as he pits to end his race. It looks like another Ferrari-powered car going pop.
2022-05-22T13:48:59Z: Russell vs Perez now, for P1. Perez is having none of his team-mate's DRS issues, and gets a good run out of the final corner to follow the Mercedes and dive down the outside for the lead!
2022-05-22T13:48:33Z: Stroll's Gasly-enforced spin has dropped him to 15th place. Meanwhile, Gasly pits and duly serves his penalty at the same time.
2022-05-22T13:47:17Z: Hugs and embraces for Leclerc in a dejected Ferrari garage. What a shame, he'd done everything right.
2022-05-22T13:47:02Z: Gasly has been given a five-second penalty for causing the clash with Stroll. Yeah, that was expected.
2022-05-22T13:46:18Z: Verstappen now pits for the second time, with a bid to undercut Russell here. Red Bull smells victory here.
2022-05-22T13:45:44Z: Ah, that wasn't the fight we predicted. Stroll and Gasly clash at the exit of Turn 1, spinning the Aston Martin driver around as the AlphaTauri defended the inside line. The incident has been noted by the stewards.
2022-05-22T13:45:37Z: Leclerc was dominating this encounter, and he's had to call it a day as the power unit squeaks its last at Turn 9 - shades of Bahrain in 2019. The Russell/Verstappen tussle is now a battle for the lead!
2022-05-22T13:44:26Z: Leclerc's going slowly! They're clearing the garage as Leclerc's lost power from an absolute canter out in front! Heartbreak for the Ferrari driver.
2022-05-22T13:43:22Z: The gaps across the midfield are starting to stabilise, with Stroll looking to get by Gasly for 14th place. Further back Albon pits for a second time and rejoins in last place.
2022-05-22T13:41:44Z: Sainz, after his earlier excursion, has made it back into the top six and he's 8s behind Bottas in fifth.
2022-05-22T13:40:54Z: Lap 25, and no repeat between Russell and Verstappen this time as the Red Bull DRS flutters open but closes again.
2022-05-22T13:39:28Z: Verstappen absolutely surges down the inside of Russell into Turn 1, but the Mercedes puts a lovely cut back around the outside into Turn 2 and holds second place! Verstappen tries to hit back on the outside of T3, but he can't make it happen. Great racing.
2022-05-22T13:38:31Z: Hamilton makes his second pitstop of the race, following his unwanted first-lap stop after his Magnussen clash, and rejoins on mediums in 19th place.
2022-05-22T13:36:24Z: Vettel also pits at the end of lap 21, following the same strategy as his former team-mate Leclerc, and returns to the track in 17th place behind current team-mate Stroll.
2022-05-22T13:36:15Z: A swift stop for Leclerc too - just 2.2s in the box - with a good lead. Gap is 5.7s at the end of lap 22 to Russell.
2022-05-22T13:34:45Z: Leclerc's lapping about 0.7-0.9s a lap slower than Russell, and now calls in for his first stop at the end of lap 21 with plenty of margin over Russell and Verstappen. He returns in the lead.
2022-05-22T13:33:16Z: Ricciardo is going backwards in this race, as he is overtaken by Schumacher for 12th place.
2022-05-22T13:32:29Z: Perez is lighting up the timing screen with a 1m27.169s, apparently on a one-stop strategy. Brave.
2022-05-22T13:31:36Z: Verstappen's kicking off about his DRS, but gets it on the start of lap 19 - but, Russell continues to hang firm despite going marginally wide into Turn 1.
2022-05-22T13:31:15Z: Sainz darts by Vettel to take seventh place with DRS on the main straight at the start of lap 19. The Spaniard would've been dreaming of a debut win at home but now he'll be hoping to rejoin the podium hunt.
2022-05-22T13:29:45Z: Perez now comes into the pits, having run out of tyres, and he'll come in for the medium rubber. He returns to the circuit some way behind Russell and Verstappen.
2022-05-22T13:28:42Z: But Verstappen's DRS DOES open this time at the start of lap 17, trying to clear Russell but can't find a way through past the Mercedes driver's stout defence.
2022-05-22T13:27:58Z: The 'In out shake it all about' pitstop cycle is almost over, bar Vettel, in the midfield, with Sainz now eighth on his recovery from his earlier off. Hamilton is 16th and Magnussen is still last, for the record.
2022-05-22T13:27:33Z: Regardless, Bottas gets through on Vettel to return to fifth place. Meanwhile, Verstappen's still having issues with DRS as he tries to get past Russell on the straight.
2022-05-22T13:26:18Z: Our mistake - that was Vettel who's yet to stop that got by! Ocon is very much still behind the Alfa driver - our apologies!
2022-05-22T13:25:09Z: Bottas, now in third, makes his pitstop - he bolts on the mediums, but he's out behind Ocon as the Alpine driver gets a handy undercut!
2022-05-22T13:23:51Z: Sainz duly gets by Norris a lap later with the aid of DRS at Turn 1 to move up to ninth place.
2022-05-22T13:23:40Z: As it happens, Russell and Verstappen pit at the end of lap 13, as does the sixth-placed Ocon. Mediums for Russell and Verstappen, and status quo remains in position terms.
2022-05-22T13:22:46Z: Lap 13 sees Norris, Schumacher and Latifi pit. Norris comes out directly in front of the recovering Sainz.
2022-05-22T13:22:33Z: Verstappen doesn't seem to be able to crack the DRS flap open, which is hindering him in this battle against Russell, but it also seems he's dropped out of the detection zone.
2022-05-22T13:21:19Z: On lap 12 Tsunoda, Ricciardo and Albon opt to pit. So everything is shaken about in the running order.
2022-05-22T13:19:59Z: The first pitstop window is blow open as Sainz, Zhou, Alonso and Gasly all dive in for fresh rubber.
2022-05-22T13:19:24Z: It's lap 11, can Perez do anything about Russell? Not quite, that Mercedes car is going great guns along the straight. A solid defence from the Brit.
2022-05-22T13:19:06Z: Norris duly gets by Schumacher to take seventh place. Not bad for a driver feeling very unwell today!
2022-05-22T13:18:39Z: Alonso gets by Gasly to move up to 12th place, while further ahead the McLarens have swapped places to see Norris go after Schumacher for seventh.
2022-05-22T13:17:56Z: I'll be honest, this was expected to be a pretty calm grand prix. Anything but so far!
2022-05-22T13:16:55Z: That's Verstappen in the gravel now at Turn 4! He's back on track behind Perez and Russell, but that's another car in the gravel as he loses the rear!
2022-05-22T13:15:37Z: Sainz gets going again down in 11th place, splitting the two AlphaTauris.
2022-05-22T13:15:07Z: Russell's now got Perez right in his mirrors now, as the Mexican looks incredibly rapid in that Red Bull right now.
2022-05-22T13:13:49Z: In truth both Alpines have produced strong starts, with Alonso going from last to 13th by lap seven. Alonso's latest victim is Vettel, with a super move up the inside at Turn 1. He was almost on the grass!
2022-05-22T13:13:03Z: Leclerc is 1.5s up the road at this stage, with Russell another 3.9s behind. Sainz is slowly coming back at Perez in fourth after a dismal start.
2022-05-22T13:12:03Z: Ocon has made a super start to this race, as he gets by Schumacher with the aid of DRS at Turn 1 to climb up to seventh place.
2022-05-22T13:10:06Z: Bottas has put a move into Turn 1 on Schumacher with DRS to cruise into sixth place, giving the Alfa driver some clean air to play with.
2022-05-22T13:08:42Z: Sainz had hit the anti-stall and got jumped off the line - seeing Russell and Perez have a minor touch into Turn 1.
2022-05-22T13:08:02Z: Leclerc begins to try and forge a lead, but Verstappen's not letting the Ferrari driver out of his sights. That said, Leclerc logs a 1m27.198s to try and scamper out of DRS range.
2022-05-22T13:07:21Z: Hamilton is back out on the track with fresh softs after repairs to his car, while Magnussen rejoins the race in last place on mediums.
2022-05-22T13:06:07Z: Both Magnussen and Hamilton drop down the order and head to the pits due to the damage picked up in that first-lap clash. The incident has been noted by the stewards.
2022-05-22T13:05:48Z: That's thrust Mick Schumacher right up into sixth place, as the Haas driver gets ahead of Bottas and Ricciardo at the start.
2022-05-22T13:05:00Z: Magnussen makes a super start to climb to seventh but clashes with Hamilton trying to go around the outside at Turn 4 and goes into the gravel. Hamilton has damage and is going slowly.
2022-05-22T13:04:37Z: Leclerc cuts off Verstappen to lead into Turn 1, as Sainz has been swamped off the line and has been overtaken by Russell and Perez!
2022-05-22T13:02:55Z: The drivers line up, ready for the start...
2022-05-22T13:00:41Z: The formation lap is away. Here we go...
2022-05-22T12:58:43Z: Tyre info: all on softs, apart from Hamilton who sits on the medium tyre.
2022-05-22T12:57:57Z: Weather info! Air temperature: scorchio, track temperature: scorchio. Chance of rain? Scorchi-no.
2022-05-22T12:54:53Z: Not long to go now! It'll be an absolute endurance round out there today. Tyres will resemble a fine camembert by the end, and so will the drivers...
2022-05-22T12:47:23Z: The drivers all opting for cool vests on the grid - apart from Valtteri Bottas, who has ice in his veins. At least he's covered his bum this time.
2022-05-22T12:46:01Z: The Spanish national anthem begins to play out courtesy of a string quintet. Carlos Sainz (and Fernando Alonso, I guess) will be hoping to hear that again later today.
2022-05-22T12:38:47Z: Red Bull has been tinkering with Verstappen's DRS for most of the day, and there's still work on it happening on the grid. Should be fine, they're no strangers to it.
2022-05-22T12:36:54Z: Autosport's own Luke Smith and Matt Kew have appeared on Spanish TV - second race in a row that Luke's been on-screen. I taught them everything they know [this message has been flagged for disinformation].
2022-05-22T12:31:26Z: Just 30 minutes to go until the Spanish Grand Prix begins! Who's your bet on - Leclerc, Verstappen, or a surprise victory contender?

2022-05-22T12:05:39Z: It's shaping up to be an interesting race, with Mercedes potentially in podium contention after largely shrugging off its porpoising issues. Ferrari seems to have better quali pace, but we expect Red Bull to be good in today's race runs.
